title: Slow-cooked lamb with pancetta
description: Invite friends for lunch round the kitchen table - the oven does the work
instructions: Preheat the oven to 170˚C, gas mark 3, fan oven 150˚C.
Dust the lamb in seasoned flour.
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a pan. Brown the lamb in batches, adding oil if needed.
Put the lamb flat in a deep oven dish.
Add the pancetta to the hot pan and fry until crisp. Scatter over the lamb.
In the remaining oil, gently brown the shallots and carrots. Add to the lamb.
Fry the onion and garlic until soft, add the brandy and reduce slightly.
Spoon onto the lamb, followed by the wine, stock, zest and rosemary.
Season, cover with foil, and cook in the oven for 2 hours until tender, removing the foil 25 minutes from the end.
Garnish with parsley and serve with roasted root vegetables.
imageDesc: A bowl containing a tender slow-cooked lamb shank sits on a plate with some root vegetables. The vegetables are scattered with rosemary and sea salt.
